title: Review VGA Amd RX Vega 64, Salah Desain Motherboard socket am4

json.text: Hello everyone Welcome back withme sofan here in reifulmogs channel.
This time I will discuss the latest vga amd as well as the latest news about your motherboard chipset amd ryzen AM4 who experience a manufacturing fault on the blackplate heatsink
Without lingering, check this out
Finally, AMD has revealed some details of his new vga,
the successor to the architecture of Polaris at the Capsaicin and Cream.
Interestingly, many thought that this would be called Vega architecture RX RX 490 or 580,
but at the time of the event the parties amd mention that named Radeon GPU RX Vega Vega.
Rx Vega planned to be present for a variety of needs ranging from Gaming PC with 4K resolution
RxVega created as the GPU chip with high performance that can meet a variety of needs with ease.
Vga card there are several new technologies, namely HBM2 Technology, High Bandwidth Cache, Next-Gen Compute Unit and many more
interestingly, there are features High Bandwidth Cache Controller (HBCC)
AMD showed how this latest cache architecture will benefit gamers by enabling developers to utilize 100 percent of system memory
and cache in the RX Vega.
Gamers will get better performance when playing FPS games with a higher course.
And there is also a feature HBM2 or high bandwitch memory
which offer efficiencies up to 5x more power with 50% smaller footprint than the GDDR5 version.
Not only that with 8x density per stack capacity
and 2x the bandwidth per pin HBM latest odds on Rx Vega later you can get up to 8GB of VRAM HBM2 very powerful
for gaming, animation and graphic of purposes other professionals!
In addition RX Vega has AMD Next-gen Compute Unit (NCU)
It is like a "Brain core" in a chip that is the center GPU computing.
Amd improve performance rx vega Compute Unit in order to bring better performance,
and is able to present the performance per Compute Units up to 15% better with lower power consumption than the previous generation.
The next feature is called Rapid Packed Math (RPM),
which will provide faster performance for rendering.
process is shown how the RX Vega was able to double the number of hairs and not by adding a second GPU,
but with only a single GPU to enable the feature RPM.
